cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi (80 km) W of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the northern Gulf Coast with the center expected to sweep across southeast Louisiana and then slow while turning west-northwest into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near/just south of New Orleans – Intracoastal City-Grand Isle area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA eastward to the MS/AL border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane Watch). Sabine Pass TX eastward to the AL/FL border, including Lakes Pontchartrain/Maurepas/Borgne and Mobile Bay (Storm Surge Watch).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect only for Pinar del Rio, Cuba (outside U.S. coast).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely at the port’s inland location
weather_observation.wind: Low–moderate chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (up to 39–57 mph) with a very small chance (≈5%) of 50-kt (58 mph) sustained winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland river port, though coastal surge 2–4 ft is forecast for nearby Lake Maurepas/Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches likely with localized 4–5 inch amounts; risk of flash/urban flooding along the Mississippi River corridor.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and possible river level rise that could disrupt cargo handling.
